intro: Amyema benguetensis, commonly known as the Benguet amyema, is a rare flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in high-altitude forest environments, often found in montane regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
